class firemon_api.apps.securitymanager.devicepacks.DevicePack(config: dict, app: App)¶

Bases: BaseRecord

Representation of the device pack

Parameters:

  • config (dict) – dictionary of things values from json

  • app (obj) – App()

Example

>>> dp = fm.sm.dp.get('juniper_srx')
>>> dp
juniper_srx
>>> dp.version
'1.24.10'

alias of CollectionConfig

name (str) – name of the artifact (dc.zip, plugin.jar, etc)

your blob of stuff

Return type:

bytes

layout() → bool | dict | str | bytes¶
template() → dict¶

Get default template format for a device.

:..note that a number of fields can take bad information, like empty strings, ‘’, and Secmanager appears to happily create devices and things will appear to work. Problems may arise on device update calls though where other parts of the system fields that should not exist and error out.

Returns:

template information for a device with defaults included

Return type:

dict

exception firemon_api.apps.securitymanager.devicepacks.DevicePackError¶

Bases: SecurityManagerError

class firemon_api.apps.securitymanager.devicepacks.DevicePacks(api: ~firemon_api.core.api.FiremonAPI, app: ~firemon_api.core.app.App, record=<class 'firemon_api.apps.securitymanager.devicepacks.DevicePack'>)¶

Bases: Endpoint

Device Packs. There is no API to query individual Device Packs to filter thus we retrieve all DPs and query locally.

Parameters:

  • api (obj) – FiremonAPI()

  • app (obj) – App()

Examples

Get a list of all device packs

>>> device_packs = fm.sm.dp.all()

Get a single device pack by artifactId

>>> dp = fm.sm.dp.get('juniper_srx')

Get a list of device packs by config options

>>> fm.sm.dp.filter(ssh=True)
all() → list[DevicePack]¶

Get all device packs

Examples

>>> device_packs = fm.sm.dp.all()
ep_name = 'plugin'¶
filter(**kwargs)¶

Retrieve a filtered list of DevicePacks

Parameters:

**kwargs – key value pairs in a device pack dictionary

Returns:

a list of DevicePack(object)

Return type:

list

Examples

>>> fm.sm.dp.filter(ssh=True)
get(*args, **kwargs) → DevicePack | None¶

Query and retrieve individual DevicePack. Spelling matters.

Parameters:

  • *args – device pack name (artifactId)

  • **kwargs – key value pairs in a device pack dictionary

Returns:

a DevicePack(object)

Return type:

DevicePack(object)

Examples

>>> fm.sm.dp.get('juniper_srx')
juniper_srx
>>> fm.sm.dp.get(groupId='com.fm.sm.dp.juniper_srx')
juniper_srx
upload(file: bytes)¶

Upload device pack

Parameters:

file (bytes) – the bytes to send that make a device pack (JAR)

Returns:

The return value. True for success upload, False otherwise

Return type:

bool

Examples

>>> fn = '/path/to/file/srx.jar'
>>> with open(fn, 'rb') as f:
>>>     file = f.read()
>>> fm.sm.dp.upload(file)

>>> fn = 'srx.jar'
>>> path = '/path/to/file/srx.jar'
>>> fm.sm.dp.upload((fn, open(path, 'rb'))

FireMon-API is a Python web wrapper for the FireMon SIP (Security Mangager, etc...) APIs. The intent is make something that is useful for quick and easy development against FireMon products.
